priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Binding Agent for Immunogenicity Tests Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C181169

self.title: CDISC SDTM Binding Agent for Immunogenicity Tests Terminology

definition: A terminology codelist relevant to the description of the agent that is binding to the entity in the ISTEST variable.
name: Binding Agent for Immunogenicity Tests
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Binding Agent for Immunogenicity Tests Terminology

terms.definition: A mixture of allergens obtained from animals.
The approximately 220-250 kDa cell surface, adhesin protein and the virulence factor for Bordetella pertussis.
A mixture of fimbriae antigens from Bordetella pertussis.
The approximately 69 kDa cell surface, autotransporter protein and the virulence factor for Bordetella pertussis.
The approximately 105 kDa secreted exotoxin and the virulence factor for Bordetella pertussis.
An animal allergen in the form of dander (skin flakes) produced by the species Felis catus (domestic cat).
The approximately 150 kDa secreted protein toxin and the virulence factor for Clostridium tetani.
The purified and detoxified form of the Clostridium tetani toxin. Toxicity of this toxin is suppressed or inactivated either by heat or with formaldehyde.
The purified and detoxified form of the Corynebacterium diphtheriae toxin. Toxicity of this toxin is suppressed or inactivated either by heat or with formaldehyde.
An animal allergen in the form of dander (skin flakes) produced by the species Bos taurus (cow).
The B subtype of nuclease produced by group A beta-hemolytic streptococci.
An animal allergen in the form of dander (skin flakes) produced by the species Canis lupus familiaris (dog).
The approximately 110 kDa structural protein that forms the nucleocapsid of the Epstein-Barr virus.
The approximately 46-55 kDa lytic protein from the Epstein-Barr virus and is the diffuse component of the Epstein-Barr virus-induced early antigen (EA) complex.
terms.preferredTerm: Epstein-Barr Virus Early Antigen Diffuse Component
synonyms: Epstein-Barr Virus Early Antigen Diffuse Component

terms.definition: The approximately 66 kDa DNA-binding protein with a designation nuclear antigen 1, from the 6 nuclear antigens produced by the Epstein-Barr virus.
One or more proteins from the 6 nuclear antigens (EBNA 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and/or 6) produced by the Epstein-Barr virus.
The approximately 21.5 kDa structural protein that forms the nucleocapsid of the Hepatitis B virus.
The approximately 16-18 kDa nonstructural tolerogen that forms in-between the nucleocapsid and the lipid envelope of, and is secreted by the Hepatitis B virus.
One or more of the three structural surface proteins, small, HBsAg S (26 kDa); middle, HBsAg M (33 kDa); and large, HBsAg L (41 kDa), that form the hepatitis B viral lipid envelope.
terms.preferredTerm: Hepatitis B Virus HBsAg Surface Protein Antigen

terms.definition: A mixture of different species (or below the species level classifications) of the herpes simplex viruses.
A mixture of different species (or below the species level classifications) of the human immunodeficiency viruses.
The approximately 160 kDa envelope glycoprotein from the human immunodeficiency virus 1. This precursor protein is further cleaved into the gp120 and gp41 proteins.
The approximately 41 kDa transmembrane, envelope glycoprotein from the human immunodeficiency virus 1. This transmembrane protein is cleaved from the precursor GP160 protein.
The approximately 24 kDa structural protein that forms the nucleocapsid of the human immunodeficiency virus 1.
The approximately 31 kDa integrase from the human immunodeficiency virus 1.
The approximately 140 kDa envelope glycoprotein from the human immunodeficiency virus 2.
The approximately 36 kDa transmembrane, envelope glycoprotein from the human immunodeficiency virus 2.
An animal allergen in the form of dander (skin flakes) produced by the species Equus caballus (domestic horse).
A mixture of different species (or below the species level classifications) of the human T-cell lymphotropic viruses.
A group of autoimmune substances found in the nucleus of a cell that are the target of autoantibodies.
The approximately 45.6 kDa structural protein that forms the nucleocapsid of the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 virus (SARS-CoV-2).
The approximately 180-200 kDa transmembrane, receptor binding protein from the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 virus (SARS-CoV-2).
An autoantigen encoded by the Ro52 gene (also called the TRIM21 gene) and has a molecular weight of 52 kDa. It is associated with the autoimmune disease Sjogrens Syndrome.
An autoantigen encoded by the Ro60 gene and has a molecular weight of 60 kDa. It is associated with the autoimmune disease Sjogrens Syndrome.
An autoantigen encoded by the SSB gene. It is associated with the autoimmune disease Sjogrens Syndrome.
The approximately 60 kDa protein that is an oxygen-labile exotoxin produced by beta-hemolytic streptococci.
The approximately 55 kDa, receptor binding B subunit of the Cholera toxin and the virulence factor for Vibrio cholerae.
